TITLE: Vintage photos show British vacationers gone wild
SUMMARY: Butlin's vacation resorts were an institution in post-war Britain. The self-contained camps -- where guests were housed in wooden chalets, fed and entertained on-site -- provided a new kind of inexpensive luxury for working families.

TITLE: Lake Balaton and the endless summers of Hungary's communist riviera
SUMMARY: During the communist era, travel options were limited in Hungary and Central Europe, which meant Lake Balaton became the region's most popular vacation destination.
